Articles.Content:
First - This bug made me back up my save for the first time (back to autosave) and it made me feel dirty as I play on Hard and that is the reason for this mission.

Basically I did not cut the fuel flow and this satellite you see was attached to docking port as decoupler. So it drained it's fuel.

So I did set up this small mission to refuel it.

I go outside, hook a winch (KIS/KAS) for stability, then a pipe and refuel it.

But upon trying to reenter the pod my kerbal clones and I will have a dead (clone) on my record.

I reverted to autosave, which did not feel good at all and just EVA her then did hit B. She cloned again.

I will post a link to this topic in the KIS thread, because I am told this causes it, but just in case it does not, please help me solve that.

Thank you in advance.

I've seen this happen with the EVA fuel tank and the US EVA-X pack, switching back and forth between the clone and the ship should cause the clone to Kraken and explode. If I recall correctly this shouldn't be recorded as a dead Kerbal.
simple, her head got impaled with the dna sampling system, causing her to be kloned
I had the same issue. After installing the Stock Bug Fix Modules i had it not any more.

I had the same issue. After installing the Stock Bug Fix Modules i had it not any more.

Do you, by any chance, know which of the Stock Bug Fix Modules fixed it?

Basically. She cloned herself. I switched to KSC then when I got back there were some phantom kraken forces that tore the real one (the one with stuff in inventory) apart. It did not count it as death, but now I have a body snatcher alien (with pink skin) that will destroy my space program from inside.

Are the winches or pipes causing it ? I want to know so I do not have to face the same thing again.

Edited June 16, 2015 by Mapoko
that would be my guess, I'd suggest un-equiping anything in a kerbonaut's inventory before going inside.
